meanings.sent1: The partitions in the classroom separate the students.
meanings.sent2: The office has glass partitions to create privacy.
meanings.sent3: The partitions at the party made it feel like a maze.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions were like partitions, each one isolated from the other.
meanings.sent5: The partitions in the beehive ensure each bee has its own space.

meanings.definition: A structure dividing a space into separate areas
meanings.sent1: The wooden partitions in the room create individual workspaces.
meanings.sent2: The cubicles are office partitions that provide privacy.
meanings.sent3: The partitions in the garden give each plant its own space to grow.
meanings.sent4: The walls acted as partitions, separating the two rival groups.
meanings.sent5: The partitions in the library help organize books by genre.

meanings.definition: To divide or separate into parts
meanings.sent1: She partitions her time between work and family.
meanings.sent2: The chef partitions the ingredients before cooking.
meanings.sent3: He partitions his closet to keep his clothes organized.
meanings.sent4: The software can partition the hard drive into different sections.
meanings.sent5: The artist partitions the canvas into distinct sections for each color.
